thread.title: Harrisonburg too much for Fort Defiance
thread.title_full: Harrisonburg too much for Fort Defiance

title: Harrisonburg too much for Fort Defiance
text:
Harrisonburg too much for Fort Defiance Staff Report 10:30 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Fort Defiance High School - Varsity Football - Lane McAllister (Photo: Mike Tripp/The News Leader) 3 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HARRISONBURG - Fort Defiance endured another tough evening on the gridiron Friday, as the Indians fell to Harrisonburg 42-0 on the Blue Streaks’ Senior Night. 
Fort’s offense gained some ground, but could not find the end zone, as its record fell to 0-8. 
Running back Austin Fitzwater did well in the running game and receiver Lane McAllister made key catches in a late first-half drive that came up short. 
The first quarter saw slow and steady progress from the Indians, before a turnover unleashed a rapid Harrisonburg counter, led by Blue Streaks senior Treyvon Medley-Green. Although neither team struggled to gain ground, both lacked the finishing touch, and the first quarter ended 0-0. 
No scoring drought plagued the Blue Streaks after the break. Harrisonburg got off the mark immediately with Rodney Morris scoring their first touchdown just 52 seconds into the second quarter. Jose Gonzalez-Cavazos stuck the extra point for a 7-0 lead. Harrisonburg wasn’t done, however, and senior Abner Johnson added to their total on a 27-yard reception with 7:41 remaining. The Streaks went into halftime ahead by a total of 22-0. Raekwon Smith added a 75 yard return in the fourth quarter and Malachi Simmons nabbed another for a final score of 42-0. 
Sophomore Anthony White shone the brightest for the Blue Streaks. The quarterback scored off an 11-yard run in the second quarter and ran a 58-yard touchdown in the third quarter. 
HARRISONBURG
